resources.string: In this game, your goal is to make the expressions true, with adding in the operators like so
Here you can see which sign performs which mathematical operation
The + sign corresponds to addition e.g. 5+5=10
The – sign corresponds to subtraction e.g. 10–5=5
The * sign corresponds to multiplication e.g. 5*5=25
The / sign corresponds to division e.g. 32/4=8
The ^ sign corresponds to exponentiation e.g. 3^4 = 3*3*3*3 = 81
The ⌊ ⌋ signs correspond to the floor function. This function takes any number as an input and outputs only the whole number part of it e.g. ⌊2.4⌋ = 2, ⌊−2.4⌋ = −3, ⌈2.4⌉ = 3 and ⌈√15⌉=3
The ! sign corresponds to the factorial function. Factorial, in mathematics, is the product of all positive integers less than or equal to a given positive integer e.g. 7! = 1*2*3*4*5*6*7=5040, by
The √ sign corresponds to taking the square root of a number. e.g. √9 = 3 √5=3.87298…

the double factorial or semifactorial of a number n, denoted by n!!, is the product of all the integers from 1 up to n that have the same parity (odd or even) as n. e.g. 9!! = 3*5*7*9 by convention 0! = 1
You can use 2 square root signs to get the fourth root e.g. √√8=2 √√5=1.4953487812
